parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lead, carry, take away; met: To be led astray, seduced. From apo and ago; to take off.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Soundless, voiceless, speechless, dumb. Figuratively, unmeaning.
An idol, false god. From eidos; an image; by implication, a heathen god, or the worship of such.
